thread.title: Phil Lesh of Grateful Dead cancels shows after cancer diagnosis
thread.title_full: Phil Lesh of Grateful Dead cancels shows after cancer diagnosis | cleveland.com

author: Associated Press
title: Phil Lesh of Grateful Dead cancels shows after cancer diagnosis
text:
SAN RAFAEL, Calif. â€” Grateful Dead bassist Phil Lesh has been diagnosed with bladder cancer and is being treated in Arizona, he says.
The 75-year-old bassist announced his illness Friday on the Facebook page of his San Rafael restaurant and concert hall, Terrapin Crossroads.
A Message from Phil: Dear Friends,I am sorry to let you know that I will need to cancel the October 24th and 25th...
Posted by Terrapin Crossroads on Friday, October 16, 2015 Lesh was diagnosed in early October and has been undergoing tests at the Mayo Clinic in Scottsdale. He said he will eventually have surgery to remove the tumors.
He said he's "very fortunate" to have the pathology reports show the tumors are all non-aggressive and that there is no indication that they have spread.
He canceled Phil Lesh and Friends shows scheduled for Oct. 24 and 25 at the Terrapin Crossroads.
Lesh said he will be able to return to normal activities two weeks after surgery and will reschedule the canceled dates.
